ingredients: 1 lb fresh okra, washed and trimmed
1/4 teaspoon red chili powder (or to taste)
instructions: Wash okra under running water and slice off the ends. Cut each in half. Set aside. Prepare onions and tomatoes. Set aside.
In a wok or heavy skillet, heat the oil and sauté onions until translucent.
Add ground cumin, ground coriander, turmeric powder, and red chili powder. Stir-fry for 2 minutes.
Add the chopped tomatoes and cook for 1 minute, stirring constantly.
Add the okra and stir-fry for 2 minutes.
Cover and steam over medium heat until tender, about 12-15 minutes.
Spoon the okra onto a warm serving plate and sprinkle with garam masala. Garnish with fresh coriander leaves and serve hot.
cooking_tips: Peel onions under cold water to avoid tears.
Bhoona is a technique that involves cooking over medium-high heat with constant stirring until all liquids are reduced and the spices coat the vegetables.
If fresh okra is not available, canned okra can be used as a substitute.  If using canned okra, add it towards the end of the cooking process.
Adjust the amount of chili powder to suit your spice preference.
